title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hebrews chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hebrews Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:1, from where is every high priest taken?
questions.correctAnswer: Among men
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:1 states that every high priest is taken from among men.

questions.question: Who does the high priest have compassion on, according to Hebrews 5:2?
options: The ignorant and those out of the way
questions.correctAnswer: The ignorant and those out of the way
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:2 says the high priest can have compassion on the ignorant and those that are out of the way.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5:4 states that any man can take the honor of being a high priest unto himself.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:4 explains that no man takes this honor unto himself, but only he who is called of God.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:5, who glorified Christ to be made a high priest?
options: God who said, 'Thou art my Son'
questions.correctAnswer: God who said, 'Thou art my Son'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:5 states Christ did not glorify Himself but was called by God who said, 'Thou art my Son.'

questions.question: Hebrews 5:6 refers to Christ as a priest after the order of whom?
questions.correctAnswer: Melchisedec
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 says Christ is a priest forever after the order of Melchisedec.

questions.question: What did Christ offer up in the days of His flesh according to Hebrews 5:7?
options: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.correctAnswer: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 describes Christ offering prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5:8 states that Christ did not learn obedience.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:8 says Christ learned obedience through the things He suffered.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:9, what did Christ become after being made perfect?
questions.correctAnswer: Author of eternal salvation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:9 notes that Christ became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him.

questions.question: Who calls Christ an high priest after the order of Melchisedec in Hebrews 5:10?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:10 states Christ was called of God as a high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 5:11 say about the readers who are dull of hearing?
options: They find it hard to understand what is said
They are wise and quick learners
They are ready to teach others
questions.correctAnswer: They find it hard to understand what is said
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:11 mentions many things to say but hard to utter because the readers are dull of hearing.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hebrews 5:12: 'Ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the ______ of God.'
questions.correctAnswer: oracles
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:12 says they need to be taught the first principles of the oracles of God.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:13, what is every one that uses milk described as?
options: Unskilful in the word of righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Unskilful in the word of righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:13 explains that those who use milk are unskilful in the word of righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5:14 says that strong meat belongs to those who are of full age.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 states strong meat belongs to those who are of full age.

questions.question: What helps those of full age to discern both good and evil according to Hebrews 5:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Their senses exercised by use
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 says their senses are exercised by use to discern good and evil.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:3, who ought the high priest offer for sins?
options: Both for the people and for himself
questions.correctAnswer: Both for the people and for himself
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:3 states the high priest ought to offer for sins for both the people and himself.

medium.title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hebrews Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with obedience during a difficult season. Based on Hebrews 5, what biblical truth would you share about learning obedience?
options: Obedience is learned through suffering and discipline
Obedience is not important for salvation
Obedience is only for priests and leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience is learned through suffering and discipline
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:8 states that Jesus, though He was a Son, learned obedience through what He suffered. This teaches us that obedience is often deepened and strengthened through trials and suffering, which helps us grow spiritually and trust God more fully.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 5 describe the role of a high priest in relation to people and God?
options: A high priest offers gifts and sacrifices for sins on behalf of the people
A high priest rules over people with authority and power
A high priest teaches only the laws without compassion
A high priest is chosen by the people for their benefit
questions.correctAnswer: A high priest offers gifts and sacrifices for sins on behalf of the people
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:1 explains that every high priest is ordained to act for men in things pertaining to God, offering gifts and sacrifices for sins. This shows the priest’s role is intercessory and sacrificial, serving both God and people.

questions.question: A believer feels ignorant and out of the way spiritually. According to Hebrews 5, how should one view the compassion of a high priest?
options: The high priest has compassion because he is also subject to weakness
The high priest has no compassion for the ignorant
The high priest condemns those who are out of the way
The high priest is perfect and without weakness
questions.correctAnswer: The high priest has compassion because he is also subject to weakness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:2 shows that the high priest can have compassion on the ignorant and those going astray because he too is surrounded by weakness. This teaches believers that God’s ministers understand human frailty and respond with mercy.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 5 teach about how a person becomes a high priest?
options: No one takes the honor to be a high priest unless called by God
Anyone can become a high priest by personal ambition
The people elect their own high priest
High priests inherit the position from their family
questions.correctAnswer: No one takes the honor to be a high priest unless called by God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:4 emphasizes that no man takes this honor upon himself but only when he is called by God, just as Aaron was. This highlights the divine calling and humility required for spiritual leadership.

questions.question: A Christian is discouraged because they feel weak in faith. How does Hebrews 5 guide believers toward spiritual maturity?
options: Believers should move beyond milk to strong meat by exercising their senses to discern good and evil
Believers should remain on milk and avoid deep teachings
Spiritual growth depends only on feelings, not study
Maturity comes by avoiding difficult teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should move beyond milk to strong meat by exercising their senses to discern good and evil
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:12-14 contrasts those needing milk (basic teachings) with those able to handle strong meat (deeper truths), encouraging believers to grow spiritually by practicing discernment and obedience.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5 teaches that Christ glorified Himself to become a high priest.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:5 states that Christ did not glorify Himself to be made a high priest; rather, God called Him, saying, 'Thou art my Son, today have I begotten thee.' This shows humility and divine appointment.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 5 encourage believers to deal with spiritual dullness or immaturity?
options: Seek to be taught again the elementary principles of God's word
Ignore the need for further teaching
Depend only on personal experience for growth
questions.correctAnswer: Seek to be taught again the elementary principles of God's word
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:11-12 points out that some believers need to be taught again the basics because they are dull of hearing, encouraging humility and a willingness to learn foundational truths as the basis for growth.

questions.question: A believer is praying earnestly during a time of distress. How does Hebrews 5 describe Christ's prayers during His days in the flesh?
options: He offered prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
He prayed without emotion or tears
He prayed only once and was not heard
questions.correctAnswer: He offered prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 describes Christ’s earnest prayers with strong crying and tears to the one able to save Him from death, demonstrating the power of heartfelt prayer and reverent fear of God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hebrews 5 teaches that strong meat belongs to those who are of ___, who have their senses exercised by use to discern good and evil.
questions.correctAnswer: full age
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 states that strong meat belongs to the mature ('full age'), those who have practiced discernment and spiritual understanding, contrasting with babes who only need milk.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 5 say about Christ’s priesthood order?
options: He is a priest forever after the order of Melchisedec
He is a priest after the order of Aaron
He is not ordained as a priest
He is a temporary priest until the law is fulfilled
questions.correctAnswer: He is a priest forever after the order of Melchisedec
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 and 5:10 clearly state that Christ is called by God to be a high priest after the order of Melchisedec, emphasizing the eternal and superior nature of His priesthood.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged because they feel imperfect. What does Hebrews 5 reveal about Christ’s perfection and its impact on salvation?
options: Christ was made perfect and became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him
Christ was perfect by nature and did not need to be made perfect
Salvation is not connected to Christ’s perfection
Christ’s perfection is irrelevant to believers
questions.correctAnswer: Christ was made perfect and became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:9 teaches that Christ, through suffering and obedience, was made perfect and thus became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey Him, encouraging believers to trust in His completed work.

questions.question: True or False: According to Hebrews 5, believers should expect to be teachers from the beginning of their faith journey.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:12 states that some believers who ought to be teachers still need to be taught the first principles, showing that spiritual teaching ability requires maturity and growth, not immediate expectation.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 5 instruct believers to view the honor of the priesthood?
options: It is not taken by self-appointment but by divine calling
It can be claimed by anyone with desire
It is based on family lineage only
It is a position of worldly power
questions.correctAnswer: It is not taken by self-appointment but by divine calling
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:4 emphasizes that no one takes the honor of priesthood upon themselves, but only when called by God, reinforcing humility and dependence on God's sovereign choice.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to discern right from wrong. What practical advice does Hebrews 5 provide for spiritual discernment?
options: By constant practice and use, believers can exercise their senses to discern good and evil
Discernment is instinctive and does not require effort
Believers should avoid making moral judgments
questions.correctAnswer: By constant practice and use, believers can exercise their senses to discern good and evil
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 teaches that mature believers exercise their senses by practice to discern good and evil, indicating that spiritual discernment requires ongoing effort and growth.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 5 suggest about the nature of Christ's prayers and reverence toward God during His earthly life?
options: He prayed with fear and was heard because of His reverence
He prayed without fear and was ignored
He did not pray as He was divine
He prayed only publicly, not privately
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed with fear and was heard because of His reverence
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 notes that Christ was heard because He feared God, showing the importance of reverence and earnestness in prayer, even for the Son of God.

hard.title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hebrews Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5, what is the primary role of the high priest taken from among men?
options: To offer gifts and sacrifices for sins
questions.correctAnswer: To offer gifts and sacrifices for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:1 states that every high priest taken from among men is ordained to offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.

questions.question: What characteristic of the high priest allows him to have compassion on the ignorant and those out of the way?
options: He himself is compassed with infirmity
He is appointed by the people
questions.correctAnswer: He himself is compassed with infirmity
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:2 explains that the high priest can have compassion because he himself is compassed with infirmity, meaning he shares human weakness.

questions.question: What is required of the high priest concerning sins, for both the people and himself?
questions.correctAnswer: To offer sacrifices for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:3 states the high priest ought to offer sacrifices for sins for both the people and himself.

questions.question: Who alone may take the honor of being a high priest unto himself?
options: He that is called of God
Any man from the tribe of Levi
The eldest son of the high priest
questions.correctAnswer: He that is called of God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:4 clarifies that no man takes this honor unto himself but he who is called of God, as was Aaron.

questions.question: Christ was made a high priest after the order of which biblical figure?
questions.correctAnswer: Melchisedec
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 and 5:10 explicitly state Christ was called an high priest after the order of Melchisedec, emphasizing a unique priesthood.

questions.question: How did Christ learn obedience according to Hebrews 5?
options: By the things which he suffered
questions.correctAnswer: By the things which he suffered
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:8 states that though He was a Son, He learned obedience by the things which He suffered, highlighting His human experience.

questions.question: In Hebrews 5:7, what method did Jesus use in His prayers during the days of His flesh?
options: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.correctAnswer: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 describes Jesus offering prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears to God who was able to save Him from death.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 5 describe the spiritual maturity of those who need 'milk' rather than 'strong meat'?
options: They are unskilful in the word of righteousness
They are teachers of the law
questions.correctAnswer: They are unskilful in the word of righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:13 explains that those who use milk are unskilful in the word of righteousness and are considered babes in faith.

questions.question: What does 'strong meat' represent in Hebrews 5, and who is it for?
options: Solid spiritual teachings for those of full age
questions.correctAnswer: Solid spiritual teachings for those of full age
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 states that strong meat belongs to those who are mature, having exercised their senses to discern good and evil.

questions.question: What does the author of Hebrews imply about the audience's spiritual progress in verse 11?
options: They are dull of hearing and find it hard to understand
They have fully grasped the complex doctrines
They are ready to lead the church
questions.correctAnswer: They are dull of hearing and find it hard to understand
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:11 states the readers are dull of hearing, making it difficult for the author to explain more complex matters.

questions.question: The phrase 'Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec' in Hebrews 5:6 alludes to which Old Testament figure?
options: Melchisedec, king of Salem and priest of the Most High God
Aaron, the first high priest of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Melchisedec, king of Salem and priest of the Most High God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 cites Psalm 110:4, referring to Melchisedec, a mysterious priest-king figure from Genesis 14, typifying Christ's eternal priesthood.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5 teaches that Christ glorified Himself to become a high priest.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:5 states Christ did not glorify Himself but was called by God to be high priest, showing divine appointment rather than self-exaltation.

questions.question: What is the significance of Christ being called a high priest after the order of Melchisedec rather than Aaron?
options: It signifies an eternal and superior priesthood not based on hereditary Levitical lineage
It means Christ was a Levite
It implies Christ served in the earthly temple
It indicates Christ was a political ruler
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies an eternal and superior priesthood not based on hereditary Levitical lineage
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 and 5:10 contrast the Levitical priesthood with Melchisedec’s order, highlighting Christ's unique, eternal priesthood beyond the Aaronic line.

questions.question: Which literary device is employed in Hebrews 5:11-14 to contrast spiritual immaturity and maturity?
options: Metaphor of milk versus strong meat
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor of milk versus strong meat
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:12-14 uses the metaphor of milk and strong meat to illustrate the difference between spiritual infancy and maturity.

questions.question: In Hebrews 5:7, what does the phrase 'was heard in that he feared' suggest about Jesus' prayer life?
options: His reverent fear and submission to God made His prayers effective
questions.correctAnswer: His reverent fear and submission to God made His prayers effective
questions.explanation: The phrase indicates that Jesus’ reverence and fear (respect) towards God resulted in His prayers being heard, emphasizing obedience and humility.

theological.title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hebrews Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:1, what is the primary role of a high priest taken from among men?
options: To offer gifts and sacrifices for sins
To rule over the people with authority
To judge disputes among the people
questions.correctAnswer: To offer gifts and sacrifices for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:1 states that a high priest is ordained to offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins. This aligns with Leviticus 16:32-33 where the high priest makes atonement for the people, and Hebrews 7:27 which speaks of Christ offering himself to bear sins.

questions.question: What characteristic of the high priest allows him to have compassion on the ignorant and those out of the way, as per Hebrews 5:2?
options: He is appointed by the people
questions.correctAnswer: He is compassed with infirmity
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:2 explains that the high priest can have compassion because he himself is surrounded by weakness or infirmity. This human weakness enables empathy, consistent with Psalm 103:14 and 2 Corinthians 12:9-10.

questions.question: Who, according to Hebrews 5:4, is qualified to take the honor of being a high priest?
options: One who is called of God
One who is elected by the people
One who is a descendant of kings
questions.correctAnswer: One who is called of God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:4 states that no one takes the honor of high priesthood upon himself, but only when called by God, as Aaron was. This reflects Numbers 16:1-40 where God's selection is authoritative and also echoes Acts 13:22.

questions.question: In Hebrews 5:5, how did Christ become high priest?
options: He was appointed by God who said, 'Thou art my Son'
He glorified himself to be made high priest
He was chosen by the elders of Israel
He inherited the position from Aaron
questions.correctAnswer: He was appointed by God who said, 'Thou art my Son'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:5 clarifies that Christ did not glorify Himself but was appointed by God with the declaration 'Thou art my Son.' This is consistent with Psalm 2:7 and Luke 3:22 affirming Christ’s divine sonship and appointment.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:6, Christ is a priest forever after which order?
questions.correctAnswer: The order of Melchisedec
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:6 states Christ is a priest forever after the order of Melchisedec, emphasizing a priesthood superior to Aaron’s, as Melchisedec was both king and priest (Genesis 14:18; Psalm 110:4).

questions.question: What kind of prayers did Christ offer during the days of His flesh according to Hebrews 5:7?
options: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.correctAnswer: Prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 describes Christ’s earnest prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears, showing His deep human suffering and dependence on the Father, consistent with Luke 22:44 and Isaiah 53:7-10.

questions.question: What was the purpose of Christ learning obedience through suffering as stated in Hebrews 5:8?
options: To be made perfect and bring eternal salvation
To demonstrate weakness to His followers
To fulfill the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: To be made perfect and bring eternal salvation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:8-9 explains Christ learned obedience through suffering and was made perfect to become the author of eternal salvation, aligning with Isaiah 53:11 and Philippians 2:8.

questions.question: Hebrews 5:10 calls Christ what in relation to God?
options: Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec
Chosen by the people to lead Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec
questions.explanation: The verse affirms Christ's divine appointment as high priest after Melchisedec’s order, consistent with Psalm 110:4 and Hebrews 7:17.

questions.question: What criticism does Hebrews 5:11 make about the audience's spiritual maturity?
questions.correctAnswer: They are dull of hearing
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:11 states the readers are dull of hearing, implying spiritual sluggishness, consistent with 1 Corinthians 3:1-3 and Proverbs 1:5.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:12, what should the audience have been doing by this time?
questions.correctAnswer: Being teachers
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:12 reproves the audience for needing to be taught again the first principles when they ought to be teachers, consistent with 2 Timothy 2:2 and Matthew 28:19-20.

questions.question: Hebrews 5:13 compares those who use milk in doctrine to whom?
options: Babes unskilful in the word of righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Babes unskilful in the word of righteousness
questions.explanation: This verse likens those who only consume spiritual milk to babes unskilful in righteousness, analogous to 1 Peter 2:2 and 1 Corinthians 3:1-2.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 5:14, who is fit to consume strong meat?
options: Those of full age who have exercised their senses
Those with no interest in doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: Those of full age who have exercised their senses
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 teaches that mature believers who have trained their senses to discern good and evil are fit for strong meat, consistent with Ephesians 4:13 and 1 Corinthians 2:14-15.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 5:3 say the high priest must offer for himself as well as for the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Offer sacrifices for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:3 states the high priest must offer sacrifices for sins for himself as well as the people, showing his own need for atonement, in line with Leviticus 16:6 and Numbers 18:1-7.

questions.question: Why was Christ heard in His prayers according to Hebrews 5:7?
options: Because He was anointed by angels
questions.correctAnswer: Because He feared God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:7 states Christ was heard because He feared God, reflecting reverent submission consistent with Psalm 34:15 and Proverbs 1:7.

questions.question: Hebrews 5:9 states Christ became the author of what?
options: Eternal salvation to all who obey Him
questions.correctAnswer: Eternal salvation to all who obey Him
questions.explanation: This verse declares Christ as the author of eternal salvation for obedient believers, which echoes John 10:28 and Romans 6:23.
